author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In verdant meadows, gas supplies,
Nature's bounty, well disguised,
Cautious optimism's prize,
The goat and rabbit harmonize.

As oil rebounds in modest dance,
With joy the dogs in meadows prance,
Yet worry lingers in their glance,
For crude, they fear, has lost its chance.

Behold the snail, slow and steady,
Gold ascends, traders ready,
Falling yields, they lay their bets,
A moment's pause, the world resets.

feedItems.title: IEA 'Cautiously Optimistic' About Natural Gas Supplies
feedItems.description: IEA said well-stocked natural gas inventories and demand reductions are reasons for “cautious optimism” about supplies.

feedItems.title: Oil Stages Modest Rebound Following Dramatic Slump
feedItems.description: Oil prices rebounded somewhat in Europe, but continued volatility suggests investors remain jumpy about the outlook for crude.

feedItems.title: Gold Climbs Amid Falling Treasury Yields
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold moved higher in Europe, with traders optimistic the Fed has finished its current hiking cycle and will hold rates for the time being.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of Volkswagen bold,
First-quarter gains were to be told,
Yet through time, prices calmed as dire,
Deceleration played its lyre.

The dollar doth falter 'fore the rate,
In Europe's grasp, its future's fate,
Expecting it t' further sink and sway,
As Federal hands withhold their say.

The Eurozone bonds, a subtle close,
As Fed the rate, with grace imposed,
The ECB, step forth to decide,
A steady path, through shadows bide.

feedItems.title: Volkswagen Performance Might Fizzle Out as Pricing Normalizes
feedItems.description: Volkswagen’s first-quarter earnings beat consensus expectations, but its confirmed guidance suggests the company’s performance will probably decelerate as prices normalize over the rest of the year, RBC said.

feedItems.title: Dollar Expected to Weaken Further as US Rate Cuts Loom
feedItems.description: The dollar was lower in Europe and many analysts expect it to drop further after the Fed raised interest rates but omitted to mention that additional policy firming may be necessary.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Barely Move After Fed, Before ECB Meetings
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields were broadly flat after the Fed delivered a 25 basis-point rate rise, as expected, and with the ECB likely to follow suit later on Thursday.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
On waves of gold, a Shell doth sail,
With buyback plan, stout earnings tale,
Nine billion suns in first-quarter's breath,
Yet tax and prices wait in death.

Heavy the Maersk did heave and moan,
Dank profits sink to depths unknown,
Whilst noble sea routes' gifts decline,
Two billion shines ere mark divine.

To German shores the trade winds blow,
Surplus bestowed, as exports slow,
A seventeen-billion treasure dear,
Yet global want doth stifle cheer.

feedItems.title: Shell Earnings Top Views, Details Buyback
feedItems.description: Shell announced a $4 billion share buyback and reported first-quarter adjusted earnings of $9.7 billion, beating expectations, but falling on quarter due to tax movements and lower prices.

feedItems.title: Maersk Weighed by Slide in Freight Rates, Volumes
feedItems.description: Maersk reported a sharp drop in first-quarter net profit to $2.3 billion, as inventory corrections in western economies caused shipping demand to normalize, pushing freight rates and volumes lower.

feedItems.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Rises; Both Exports and Imports Fall
feedItems.description: Germany’s adjusted trade surplus climbed to €17 billion in March, with exports falling by a much bigger-than-expected 5.2%, reflecting a slide in the global demand for the country’s manufactured goods.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of BMW, a tale wondrous to hear,
On earnings of autos, profits appear,
Revenues raised, and elect'ric delight,
Of top-end and wheeled steeds made of light.

Rheinmetall the known, their forecast backs,
As sales do rise on invasion's tracks,
A twelveth of gains, their coffers doth fill,
In weapons trade, a bitter sweet thrill.

Volkswagen firm, in guidance remains,
Their chariots sought, across many terrains,
In Europe and lands to the west they ride,
On strong demand, profits doth glide.

feedItems.title: BMW Keeps Outlook After Solid First Quarter
feedItems.description: BMW confirmed its forecast of an 8%-10% underlying earnings margin for its automotive segment in 2023 after it reported higher revenues and profits in the first quarter on good pricing and sales of top-end and electric vehicles.

feedItems.title: Rheinmetall Backs Guidance After Sales Boost
feedItems.description: Rheinmetall targeted an operating margin of roughly 12% this year and confirmed its forecast of significant sales growth after demand for military procurement increased following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

feedItems.title: Volkswagen Confirms Guidance After Strong Sales Growth
feedItems.description: Volkswagen confirmed its financial targets for 2023 after reporting a 35% rise in underlying operating profit to €7 billion, as revenue jumped on strong demand for its cars in Europe and North America.
